snippet: The Federal Aviation Administration’s move to allow electronic devices throughout a flight highlights the grindingly slow process of removing government regulations.
abstract: Tyler Cohen Economic View column observes that Federal Aviation Administration’s move to allow electronic devices throughout a flight highlights the grindingly slow process of removing government regulations; says tangle of federal regulations still clogs the books--and endangers economic growth.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Aviation Administration’s move to allow electronic devices throughout a flight highlights the grindingly slow process of removing government regulations.

headline.print_headline: More Freedom on the Airplane, if Nowhere Else
headline.main: More Freedom on the Airplane, if Nowhere Else

keywords.value: Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (US)
